author: Matt Bassil
description:
2025 is looking like a good year for Pokémon promo cards. A ton of them have begun to gain value, but here we’ll look at just two that have doubled in price over the past six months.

Continue reading These promo Pokémon cards have doubled in price
MORE FROM WARGAMER: Best Pokémon cards, Rare Pokémon cards, All Pokémon sets in order
title: These promo Pokémon cards have doubled in price

author: Matt Bassil
description:
Darrington Press, the tabletop games imprint for Critical Role, has a new title on the way, and preorders just opened up. Solar Gardens is a tile-based board game set in a high-tech, utopian future.

Players are tasked with building a rooftop garden powered by sustainable energy sources. In practice, they do this by grabbing tiles and placing them in just the right places to score big.

Continue reading Critical Role's next board game is a Solarpunk tile-layer about green gardening
MORE FROM WARGAMER: Best board games , Couples' board games, Board games for adults
title: Critical Role's next board game is a Solarpunk tile-layer about green gardening

author: Timothy Linward
description:
Sometimes I wish there was a word other than ‘miniature’ to describe the collectible figurines we build and paint in the miniature wargaming hobby, because a lot of ‘miniatures’ are very, very big indeed. And as if to prove the point, Steamforged Games has revealed photos of the fully painted Dusk Phantasm, a Colossal war robot for its flagship tabletop wargame Warmachine.

Continue reading No, this isn't from a Gundam miniature wargame - meet Warmachine's new Colossal
MORE FROM WARGAMER: Guide to Warhammer 40k factions, Painting miniatures, Warhammer Age of Sigmar Armies guide
title: No, this isn't from a Gundam miniature wargame - meet Warmachine's new Colossal

author: Timothy Linward
description:
Wargamer confidently predicts that the Warhammer: The Horus Heresy Saturnine release date will be July 26. A recent Warhammer Community article sets out a roadmap for free downloadable rules PDFs for the Horus Heresy third edition, which starts in July - and, given everything we know about how GW markets this kind of product, this means the only possible date Saturnine can release on will be July 26.

Continue reading Alert - GW let slip the Warhammer The Horus Heresy Saturnine release date!
MORE FROM WARGAMER: Horus Heresy book order, Warhammer 40k factions, Warhammer 40k primarchs
title: Alert - GW let slip the Warhammer The Horus Heresy Saturnine release date!

author: Matt Bassil
description:
We’ve got a bumper crop of Magic: The Gathering price spikes to cover today, as loads of equipment-related cards are rising in value - including some that were already very popular staples.

Continue reading MTG's white equipment-themed cards are all spiking by up to 150%
MORE FROM WARGAMER: All MTG sets in order, Upcoming MTG release dates, How to play MTG
title: MTG's white equipment-themed cards are all spiking by up to 150%

author: Mollie Russell
description:
Dungeons and Dragons most recent playtest takes a second stab at redesigning the Hexblade subclass, with clunky yet promising results. Hexblade 2.0 looks more interesting and thematic than its previous version, and it could be great fun to play with a few creases ironed out. However, D&D fans who lamented the old Hexblade’s reliance on a concentration spell will be disappointed to see that its design identity hasn’t strayed too far from playtest one.

Continue reading DnD's updated Hexblade subclass is painfully close to greatness
title: DnD's updated Hexblade subclass is painfully close to greatness
